00022 /* This code is inspired by the Arduino GCode Interpreter by Mike Ellery and the NIST RS274/NGC Interpreter
00023    by Kramer, Proctor and Messina. */
00024 
00025 #include "system.h"
00026 #include "settings.h"
00027 #include "protocol.h"
00028 #include "gcode.h"
00029 #include "motion_control.h"
00030 #include "spindle_control.h"
00031 #include "coolant_control.h"
00032 #include "report.h"
00033 
00034 // Declare gc extern struct
00035 parser_state_t gc;
00036 
00037 #define FAIL(status) gc.status_code = status;
00038 
00039 static uint8_t next_statement(char *letter, float *float_ptr, char *line, uint8_t *char_counter);
00040 static void gc_convert_arc_radius_mode(float *target) __attribute__((noinline));
00041 
00042 
00043 static void select_plane(uint8_t axis_0, uint8_t axis_1, uint8_t axis_2) 
00044 {
00045   gc.plane_axis_0 = axis_0;
00046   gc.plane_axis_1 = axis_1;
00047   gc.plane_axis_2 = axis_2;
00048 }
00049 
00050 
00051 void gc_init() 
00052 {
00053   memset(&gc, 0, sizeof(gc));
00054   gc.feed_rate = settings.default_feed_rate;
00055   select_plane(X_AXIS, Y_AXIS, Z_AXIS);
00056   gc.absolute_mode = true;
00057   
00058   // Load default G54 coordinate system.
00059   if (!(settings_read_coord_data(gc.coord_select,gc.coord_system))) { 
00060     report_status_message(STATUS_SETTING_READ_FAIL); 
00061   } 
00062 }
00063 
00064 
00065 // Sets g-code parser position in mm. Input in steps. Called by the system abort and hard
00066 // limit pull-off routines.
00067 void gc_sync_position() 
00068 {
00069   uint8_t i;
00070   for (i=0; i<N_AXIS; i++) {
00071     gc.position[i] = sys.position[i]/settings.steps_per_mm[i];
00072   }
00073 }
00074 
00075 
00076 static float to_millimeters(float value) 
00077 {
00078   return(gc.inches_mode ? (value * MM_PER_INCH) : value);
00079 }
00080 
00081          
00082 // Executes one line of 0-terminated G-Code. The line is assumed to contain only uppercase
00083 // characters and signed floating point values (no whitespace). Comments and block delete
00084 // characters have been removed. In this function, all units and positions are converted and 
00085 // exported to grbl's internal functions in terms of (mm, mm/min) and absolute machine 
00086 // coordinates, respectively.
00087 uint8_t gc_execute_line(char *line) 
00088 {
00089   uint8_t char_counter = 0;  
00090   char letter;
00091   float value;
00092   int int_value;
00093   
00094   uint16_t modal_group_words = 0;  // Bitflag variable to track and check modal group words in block
00095   uint8_t axis_words = 0;          // Bitflag to track which XYZ(ABC) parameters exist in block
00096 
00097   float inverse_feed_rate = -1; // negative inverse_feed_rate means no inverse_feed_rate specified
00098   uint8_t absolute_override = false; // true(1) = absolute motion for this block only {G53}
00099   uint8_t non_modal_action = NON_MODAL_NONE; // Tracks the actions of modal group 0 (non-modal)
00100   
00101   float target[N_AXIS];
00102   clear_vector(target); // XYZ(ABC) axes parameters.
00103 
00104   #ifdef USE_LINE_NUMBERS
00105   int32_t line_number = 0;
00106   #endif
00107   gc.arc_radius = 0;
00108   clear_vector(gc.arc_offset); // IJK Arc offsets are incremental. Value of zero indicates no change.
00109 
00110   gc.status_code = STATUS_OK;
00111   
00112   /* Pass 1: Commands and set all modes. Check for modal group violations.
00113      NOTE: Modal group numbers are defined in Table 4 of NIST RS274-NGC v3, pg.20 */
00114   uint8_t group_number = MODAL_GROUP_NONE;
00115   while(next_statement(&letter, &value, line, &char_counter)) {
00116     int_value = trunc(value);
00117     switch(letter) {
00118       case 'G':
00119         // Set modal group values
00120         switch(int_value) {
00121           case 4: case 10: case 28: case 30: case 53: case 92: group_number = MODAL_GROUP_0; break;
00122           case 0: case 1: case 2: case 3: case 38: case 80: group_number = MODAL_GROUP_1; break;
00123           case 17: case 18: case 19: group_number = MODAL_GROUP_2; break;
00124           case 90: case 91: group_number = MODAL_GROUP_3; break;
00125           case 93: case 94: group_number = MODAL_GROUP_5; break;
00126           case 20: case 21: group_number = MODAL_GROUP_6; break;
00127           case 54: case 55: case 56: case 57: case 58: case 59: group_number = MODAL_GROUP_12; break;
00128         }          
00129         // Set 'G' commands
00130         switch(int_value) {
00131           case 0: gc.motion_mode = MOTION_MODE_SEEK; break;
00132           case 1: gc.motion_mode = MOTION_MODE_LINEAR; break;
00133           case 2: gc.motion_mode = MOTION_MODE_CW_ARC; break;
00134           case 3: gc.motion_mode = MOTION_MODE_CCW_ARC; break;
00135           case 4: non_modal_action = NON_MODAL_DWELL; break;
00136           case 10: non_modal_action = NON_MODAL_SET_COORDINATE_DATA; break;
00137           case 17: select_plane(X_AXIS, Y_AXIS, Z_AXIS); break;
00138           case 18: select_plane(Z_AXIS, X_AXIS, Y_AXIS); break;
00139           case 19: select_plane(Y_AXIS, Z_AXIS, X_AXIS); break;
00140           case 20: gc.inches_mode = true; break;
00141           case 21: gc.inches_mode = false; break;
00142           case 28: case 30: 
00143             int_value = trunc(10*value); // Multiply by 10 to pick up Gxx.1
00144             switch(int_value) {
00145               case 280: non_modal_action = NON_MODAL_GO_HOME_0; break;
00146               case 281: non_modal_action = NON_MODAL_SET_HOME_0; break;
00147               case 300: non_modal_action = NON_MODAL_GO_HOME_1; break;
00148               case 301: non_modal_action = NON_MODAL_SET_HOME_1; break;
00149               default: FAIL(STATUS_UNSUPPORTED_STATEMENT);
00150             }
00151             break;
00152           case 38: 
00153             int_value = trunc(10*value); // Multiply by 10 to pick up Gxx.1
00154             switch(int_value) {
00155               case 382: gc.motion_mode = MOTION_MODE_PROBE; break;
00156               // case 383: gc.motion_mode = MOTION_MODE_PROBE_NO_ERROR; break; // Not supported.
00157               // case 384: // Not supported.
00158               // case 385: // Not supported.                            
00159               default: FAIL(STATUS_UNSUPPORTED_STATEMENT);
00160             }
00161             break;  
00162           case 53: absolute_override = true; break;
00163           case 54: case 55: case 56: case 57: case 58: case 59:
00164             gc.coord_select = int_value-54;
00165             break;
00166           case 80: gc.motion_mode = MOTION_MODE_CANCEL; break;
00167           case 90: gc.absolute_mode = true; break;
00168           case 91: gc.absolute_mode = false; break;
00169           case 92: 
00170             int_value = trunc(10*value); // Multiply by 10 to pick up G92.1
00171             switch(int_value) {
00172               case 920: non_modal_action = NON_MODAL_SET_COORDINATE_OFFSET; break;        
00173               case 921: non_modal_action = NON_MODAL_RESET_COORDINATE_OFFSET; break;
00174               default: FAIL(STATUS_UNSUPPORTED_STATEMENT);
00175             }
00176             break;
00177           case 93: gc.inverse_feed_rate_mode = true; break;
00178           case 94: gc.inverse_feed_rate_mode = false; break;
00179           default: FAIL(STATUS_UNSUPPORTED_STATEMENT);
00180         }
00181         break;        
00182       case 'M':
00183         // Set modal group values
00184         switch(int_value) {
00185           case 0: case 1: case 2: case 30: group_number = MODAL_GROUP_4; break;
00186           case 3: case 4: case 5: group_number = MODAL_GROUP_7; break;
00187           case 7: case 8: case 9: group_number = MODAL_GROUP_8; break;
00188         }        
00189         // Set 'M' commands
00190         switch(int_value) {
00191           case 0: gc.program_flow = PROGRAM_FLOW_PAUSED; break; // Program pause
00192           case 1: break; // Optional stop not supported. Ignore.
00193           case 2: case 30: gc.program_flow = PROGRAM_FLOW_COMPLETED; break; // Program end and reset 
00194           case 3: gc.spindle_direction = SPINDLE_ENABLE_CW; break;
00195           case 4: gc.spindle_direction = SPINDLE_ENABLE_CCW; break;
00196           case 5: gc.spindle_direction = SPINDLE_DISABLE; break;
00197           #ifdef ENABLE_M7
00198             case 7: gc.coolant_mode = COOLANT_MIST_ENABLE; break;
00199           #endif
00200           case 8: gc.coolant_mode = COOLANT_FLOOD_ENABLE; break;
00201           case 9: gc.coolant_mode = COOLANT_DISABLE; break;
00202           default: FAIL(STATUS_UNSUPPORTED_STATEMENT);
00203         }            
00204         break;
00205     }    
00206     // Check for modal group multiple command violations in the current block
00207     if (group_number) {
00208       if ( bit_istrue(modal_group_words,bit(group_number)) ) {
00209         FAIL(STATUS_MODAL_GROUP_VIOLATION);
00210       } else {
00211         bit_true(modal_group_words,bit(group_number));
00212       }
00213       group_number = MODAL_GROUP_NONE; // Reset for next command.
00214     }
00215   } 
00216 
00217   // If there were any errors parsing this line, we will return right away with the bad news
00218   if (gc.status_code) { return(gc.status_code); }
00219   
00220   /* Pass 2: Parameters. All units converted according to current block commands. Position 
00221      parameters are converted and flagged to indicate a change. These can have multiple connotations
00222      for different commands. Each will be converted to their proper value upon execution. 
00223      NOTE: Grbl unconventionally pre-converts these parameter values based on the block G and M 
00224      commands. This is set out of the order of execution defined by NIST only for code efficiency/size 
00225      purposes, but should not affect proper g-code execution. */ 
00226   float p = 0;
00227   uint8_t l = 0;
00228   char_counter = 0;
00229   while(next_statement(&letter, &value, line, &char_counter)) {
00230     switch(letter) {
00231       case 'G': case 'M': break; // Ignore command statements and line numbers
00232       case 'F': 
00233         if (value <= 0) { FAIL(STATUS_INVALID_STATEMENT); } // Must be greater than zero
00234         if (gc.inverse_feed_rate_mode) {
00235           inverse_feed_rate = to_millimeters(value); // seconds per motion for this motion only
00236         } else {          
00237           gc.feed_rate = to_millimeters(value); // millimeters per minute
00238         }
00239         break;
00240       case 'I': case 'J': case 'K': gc.arc_offset[letter-'I'] = to_millimeters(value); break;
00241       case 'L': l = trunc(value); break;
00242       case 'N': 
00243         #ifdef USE_LINE_NUMBERS
00244         line_number = trunc(value); 
00245         #endif
00246         break;
00247       case 'P': p = value; break;                    
00248       case 'R': gc.arc_radius = to_millimeters(value); break;
00249       case 'S': 
00250         if (value < 0) { FAIL(STATUS_INVALID_STATEMENT); } // Cannot be negative
00251         gc.spindle_speed = value;
00252         break;
00253       case 'T': 
00254         if (value < 0) { FAIL(STATUS_INVALID_STATEMENT); } // Cannot be negative
00255         gc.tool = trunc(value); 
00256         break;
00257       case 'X': target[X_AXIS] = to_millimeters(value); bit_true(axis_words,bit(X_AXIS)); break;
00258       case 'Y': target[Y_AXIS] = to_millimeters(value); bit_true(axis_words,bit(Y_AXIS)); break;
00259       case 'Z': target[Z_AXIS] = to_millimeters(value); bit_true(axis_words,bit(Z_AXIS)); break;
00260       default: FAIL(STATUS_UNSUPPORTED_STATEMENT);
00261     }
00262   }
00263   
00264   // If there were any errors parsing this line, we will return right away with the bad news
00265   if (gc.status_code) { return(gc.status_code); }
00266   
00267   // Initialize axis index
00268   uint8_t idx;
00269 
00270   /* Execute Commands: Perform by order of execution defined in NIST RS274-NGC.v3, Table 8, pg.41. */
00271     
00272   // ([F]: Set feed rate.)
00273     
00274   if (sys.state != STATE_CHECK_MODE) { 
00275     //  ([M6]: Tool change should be executed here.)
00276 
00277     // [M3,M4,M5]: Update spindle state
00278     if (bit_istrue(modal_group_words,bit(MODAL_GROUP_7))) {
00279       spindle_run(gc.spindle_direction, gc.spindle_speed); 
00280     }
00281   
00282     // [*M7,M8,M9]: Update coolant state
00283     if (bit_istrue(modal_group_words,bit(MODAL_GROUP_8))) {
00284       coolant_run(gc.coolant_mode);
00285     }
00286   }
00287   
00288   // [G54,G55,...,G59]: Coordinate system selection
00289   if ( bit_istrue(modal_group_words,bit(MODAL_GROUP_12)) ) { // Check if called in block
00290     float coord_data[N_AXIS];
00291     if (!(settings_read_coord_data(gc.coord_select,coord_data))) { return(STATUS_SETTING_READ_FAIL); } 
00292     memcpy(gc.coord_system,coord_data,sizeof(coord_data));
00293   }
00294   
00295   // [G4,G10,G28,G30,G92,G92.1]: Perform dwell, set coordinate system data, homing, or set axis offsets.
00296   // NOTE: These commands are in the same modal group, hence are mutually exclusive. G53 is in this
00297   // modal group and do not effect these actions.
00298   switch (non_modal_action) {
00299     case NON_MODAL_DWELL:
00300       if (p < 0) { // Time cannot be negative.
00301         FAIL(STATUS_INVALID_STATEMENT); 
00302       } else {
00303         // Ignore dwell in check gcode modes
00304         if (sys.state != STATE_CHECK_MODE) { mc_dwell(p); }
00305       }
00306       break;
00307     case NON_MODAL_SET_COORDINATE_DATA:
00308       int_value = trunc(p); // Convert p value to int.
00309       if ((l != 2 && l != 20) || (int_value < 0 || int_value > N_COORDINATE_SYSTEM)) { // L2 and L20. P1=G54, P2=G55, ... 
00310         FAIL(STATUS_UNSUPPORTED_STATEMENT); 
00311       } else if (!axis_words && l==2) { // No axis words.
00312         FAIL(STATUS_INVALID_STATEMENT);
00313       } else {
00314         if (int_value > 0) { int_value--; } // Adjust P1-P6 index to EEPROM coordinate data indexing.
00315         else { int_value = gc.coord_select; } // Index P0 as the active coordinate system
00316         float coord_data[N_AXIS];
00317         if (!settings_read_coord_data(int_value,coord_data)) { return(STATUS_SETTING_READ_FAIL); }
00318         // Update axes defined only in block. Always in machine coordinates. Can change non-active system.
00319         for (idx=0; idx<N_AXIS; idx++) { // Axes indices are consistent, so loop may be used.
00320           if (bit_istrue(axis_words,bit(idx)) ) {
00321             if (l == 20) {
00322               coord_data[idx] = gc.position[idx]-target[idx]; // L20: Update axis current position to target
00323             } else {
00324               coord_data[idx] = target[idx]; // L2: Update coordinate system axis
00325             }
00326           }
00327         }
00328         settings_write_coord_data(int_value,coord_data);
00329         // Update system coordinate system if currently active.
00330         if (gc.coord_select == int_value) { memcpy(gc.coord_system,coord_data,sizeof(coord_data)); }
00331       }
00332       axis_words = 0; // Axis words used. Lock out from motion modes by clearing flags.
00333       break;
00334     case NON_MODAL_GO_HOME_0: case NON_MODAL_GO_HOME_1: 
00335       // Move to intermediate position before going home. Obeys current coordinate system and offsets 
00336       // and absolute and incremental modes.
00337       if (axis_words) {
00338         // Apply absolute mode coordinate offsets or incremental mode offsets.
00339         for (idx=0; idx<N_AXIS; idx++) { // Axes indices are consistent, so loop may be used.
00340           if ( bit_istrue(axis_words,bit(idx)) ) {
00341             if (gc.absolute_mode) {
00342               target[idx] += gc.coord_system[idx] + gc.coord_offset[idx];
00343             } else {
00344               target[idx] += gc.position[idx];
00345             }
00346           } else {
00347             target[idx] = gc.position[idx];
00348           }
00349         }
00350         #ifdef USE_LINE_NUMBERS
00351         mc_line(target, -1.0, false, line_number);
00352         #else
00353         mc_line(target, -1.0, false);
00354         #endif
00355       }
00356       // Retreive G28/30 go-home position data (in machine coordinates) from EEPROM
00357       float coord_data[N_AXIS];
00358       if (non_modal_action == NON_MODAL_GO_HOME_0) {
00359         if (!settings_read_coord_data(SETTING_INDEX_G28,coord_data)) { return(STATUS_SETTING_READ_FAIL); }
00360       } else {
00361         if (!settings_read_coord_data(SETTING_INDEX_G30,coord_data)) { return(STATUS_SETTING_READ_FAIL); }
00362       }
00363       #ifdef USE_LINE_NUMBERS
00364       mc_line(coord_data, -1.0, false, line_number); 
00365       #else
00366       mc_line(coord_data, -1.0, false); 
00367       #endif
00368       memcpy(gc.position, coord_data, sizeof(coord_data)); // gc.position[] = coord_data[];
00369       axis_words = 0; // Axis words used. Lock out from motion modes by clearing flags.
00370       break;
00371     case NON_MODAL_SET_HOME_0: case NON_MODAL_SET_HOME_1:
00372       if (non_modal_action == NON_MODAL_SET_HOME_0) {
00373         settings_write_coord_data(SETTING_INDEX_G28,gc.position);
00374       } else {
00375         settings_write_coord_data(SETTING_INDEX_G30,gc.position);
00376       }
00377       break;
00378     case NON_MODAL_SET_COORDINATE_OFFSET:
00379       if (!axis_words) { // No axis words
00380         FAIL(STATUS_INVALID_STATEMENT);
00381       } else {
00382         // Update axes defined only in block. Offsets current system to defined value. Does not update when
00383         // active coordinate system is selected, but is still active unless G92.1 disables it. 
00384         for (idx=0; idx<N_AXIS; idx++) { // Axes indices are consistent, so loop may be used.
00385           if (bit_istrue(axis_words,bit(idx)) ) {
00386             gc.coord_offset[idx] = gc.position[idx]-gc.coord_system[idx]-target[idx];
00387           }
00388         }
00389       }
00390       axis_words = 0; // Axis words used. Lock out from motion modes by clearing flags.
00391       break;
00392     case NON_MODAL_RESET_COORDINATE_OFFSET: 
00393       clear_vector(gc.coord_offset); // Disable G92 offsets by zeroing offset vector.
00394       break;
00395   }
00396 
00397   // [G0,G1,G2,G3,G80]: Perform motion modes. 
00398   // NOTE: Commands G10,G28,G30,G92 lock out and prevent axis words from use in motion modes. 
00399   // Enter motion modes only if there are axis words or a motion mode command word in the block.
00400   if ( bit_istrue(modal_group_words,bit(MODAL_GROUP_1)) || axis_words ) {
00401 
00402     // G1,G2,G3 require F word in inverse time mode.  
00403     if ( gc.inverse_feed_rate_mode ) { 
00404       if (inverse_feed_rate < 0 && gc.motion_mode != MOTION_MODE_CANCEL) {
00405         FAIL(STATUS_INVALID_STATEMENT);
00406       }
00407     }
00408     // Absolute override G53 only valid with G0 and G1 active.
00409     if ( absolute_override && !(gc.motion_mode == MOTION_MODE_SEEK || gc.motion_mode == MOTION_MODE_LINEAR)) {
00410       FAIL(STATUS_INVALID_STATEMENT);
00411     }
00412     // Report any errors.  
00413     if (gc.status_code) { return(gc.status_code); }
00414 
00415     // Convert all target position data to machine coordinates for executing motion. Apply
00416     // absolute mode coordinate offsets or incremental mode offsets.
00417     // NOTE: Tool offsets may be appended to these conversions when/if this feature is added.
00418     for (idx=0; idx<N_AXIS; idx++) { // Axes indices are consistent, so loop may be used to save flash space.
00419       if ( bit_istrue(axis_words,bit(idx)) ) {
00420         if (!absolute_override) { // Do not update target in absolute override mode
00421           if (gc.absolute_mode) {
00422             target[idx] += gc.coord_system[idx] + gc.coord_offset[idx]; // Absolute mode
00423           } else {
00424             target[idx] += gc.position[idx]; // Incremental mode
00425           }
00426         }
00427       } else {
00428         target[idx] = gc.position[idx]; // No axis word in block. Keep same axis position.
00429       }
00430     }
00431   
00432     switch (gc.motion_mode) {
00433       case MOTION_MODE_CANCEL: 
00434         if (axis_words) { FAIL(STATUS_INVALID_STATEMENT); } // No axis words allowed while active.
00435         break;
00436       case MOTION_MODE_SEEK:
00437         if (!axis_words) { FAIL(STATUS_INVALID_STATEMENT);} 
00438         else { 
00439           #ifdef USE_LINE_NUMBERS
00440           mc_line(target, -1.0, false, line_number);
00441           #else
00442           mc_line(target, -1.0, false);
00443           #endif
00444         }
00445         break;
00446       case MOTION_MODE_LINEAR:
00447         // TODO: Inverse time requires F-word with each statement. Need to do a check. Also need
00448         // to check for initial F-word upon startup. Maybe just set to zero upon initialization
00449         // and after an inverse time move and then check for non-zero feed rate each time. This
00450         // should be efficient and effective.
00451         if (!axis_words) { FAIL(STATUS_INVALID_STATEMENT);} 
00452         else { 
00453           #ifdef USE_LINE_NUMBERS
00454           mc_line(target, (gc.inverse_feed_rate_mode) ? inverse_feed_rate : gc.feed_rate, gc.inverse_feed_rate_mode, line_number);
00455           #else
00456           mc_line(target, (gc.inverse_feed_rate_mode) ? inverse_feed_rate : gc.feed_rate, gc.inverse_feed_rate_mode);
00457           #endif
00458         }
00459         break;
00460       case MOTION_MODE_CW_ARC: case MOTION_MODE_CCW_ARC:
00461         // Check if at least one of the axes of the selected plane has been specified. If in center 
00462         // format arc mode, also check for at least one of the IJK axes of the selected plane was sent.
00463         if ( !( bit_false(axis_words,bit(gc.plane_axis_2)) ) || 
00464              ( !gc.arc_radius && !gc.arc_offset[gc.plane_axis_0] && !gc.arc_offset[gc.plane_axis_1] ) ) { 
00465           FAIL(STATUS_INVALID_STATEMENT);
00466         } else {
00467           if (gc.arc_radius != 0) { // Arc Radius Mode
00468             // Compute arc radius and offsets
00469             gc_convert_arc_radius_mode(target);
00470             if (gc.status_code) { return(gc.status_code); }
00471           } else { // Arc Center Format Offset Mode            
00472             gc.arc_radius = hypot(gc.arc_offset[gc.plane_axis_0], gc.arc_offset[gc.plane_axis_1]); // Compute arc radius for mc_arc
00473           }
00474           
00475           // Set clockwise/counter-clockwise sign for mc_arc computations
00476           uint8_t isclockwise = false;
00477           if (gc.motion_mode == MOTION_MODE_CW_ARC) { isclockwise = true; }
00478     
00479           // Trace the arc
00480           #ifdef USE_LINE_NUMBERS
00481           mc_arc(gc.position, target, gc.arc_offset, gc.plane_axis_0, gc.plane_axis_1, gc.plane_axis_2,
00482             (gc.inverse_feed_rate_mode) ? inverse_feed_rate : gc.feed_rate, gc.inverse_feed_rate_mode,
00483             gc.arc_radius, isclockwise, line_number);
00484           #else
00485           mc_arc(gc.position, target, gc.arc_offset, gc.plane_axis_0, gc.plane_axis_1, gc.plane_axis_2,
00486             (gc.inverse_feed_rate_mode) ? inverse_feed_rate : gc.feed_rate, gc.inverse_feed_rate_mode,
00487             gc.arc_radius, isclockwise);
00488           #endif
00489         }            
00490         break;
00491       case MOTION_MODE_PROBE:
00492         if (!axis_words) { FAIL(STATUS_INVALID_STATEMENT); }
00493         else {
00494           #ifdef USE_LINE_NUMBERS
00495           mc_probe_cycle(target, (gc.inverse_feed_rate_mode) ? inverse_feed_rate : gc.feed_rate, gc.inverse_feed_rate_mode, line_number);
00496           #else
00497           mc_probe_cycle(target, (gc.inverse_feed_rate_mode) ? inverse_feed_rate : gc.feed_rate, gc.inverse_feed_rate_mode);
00498           #endif
00499         }
00500         break;
00501     }
00502     
00503     // Report any errors.
00504     if (gc.status_code) { return(gc.status_code); }    
00505     
00506     // As far as the parser is concerned, the position is now == target. In reality the
00507     // motion control system might still be processing the action and the real tool position
00508     // in any intermediate location.
00509     memcpy(gc.position, target, sizeof(target)); // gc.position[] = target[];
00510   }
00511   
00512   // M0,M1,M2,M30: Perform non-running program flow actions. During a program pause, the buffer may 
00513   // refill and can only be resumed by the cycle start run-time command.
00514   if (gc.program_flow) { 
00515     protocol_buffer_synchronize(); // Finish all remaining buffered motions. Program paused when complete.
00516     sys.auto_start = false; // Disable auto cycle start. Forces pause until cycle start issued.
00517   
00518     // If complete, reset to reload defaults (G92.2,G54,G17,G90,G94,M48,G40,M5,M9). Otherwise,
00519     // re-enable program flow after pause complete, where cycle start will resume the program.
00520     if (gc.program_flow == PROGRAM_FLOW_COMPLETED) { mc_reset(); }
00521     else { gc.program_flow = PROGRAM_FLOW_RUNNING; }
00522   }
00523   
00524   return(gc.status_code);
00525 }
00526 
00527 // Parses the next statement and leaves the counter on the first character following
00528 // the statement. Returns 1 if there was a statements, 0 if end of string was reached
00529 // or there was an error (check state.status_code).
00530 static uint8_t next_statement(char *letter, float *float_ptr, char *line, uint8_t *char_counter) 
00531 {
00532   if (line[*char_counter] == 0) {
00533     return(0); // No more statements
00534   }
00535   
00536   *letter = line[*char_counter];
00537   if((*letter < 'A') || (*letter > 'Z')) {
00538     FAIL(STATUS_EXPECTED_COMMAND_LETTER);
00539     return(0);
00540   }
00541   (*char_counter)++;
00542   if (!read_float(line, char_counter, float_ptr)) {
00543     FAIL(STATUS_BAD_NUMBER_FORMAT); 
00544     return(0);
00545   };
00546   return(1);
00547 }
00548 
00549 
00550 static void gc_convert_arc_radius_mode(float *target)  
00551 {
00552 /*  We need to calculate the center of the circle that has the designated radius and passes
00553     through both the current position and the target position. This method calculates the following
00554     set of equations where [x,y] is the vector from current to target position, d == magnitude of 
00555     that vector, h == hypotenuse of the triangle formed by the radius of the circle, the distance to
00556     the center of the travel vector. A vector perpendicular to the travel vector [-y,x] is scaled to the 
00557     length of h [-y/d*h, x/d*h] and added to the center of the travel vector [x/2,y/2] to form the new point 
00558     [i,j] at [x/2-y/d*h, y/2+x/d*h] which will be the center of our arc.
00559     
00560     d^2 == x^2 + y^2
00561     h^2 == r^2 - (d/2)^2
00562     i == x/2 - y/d*h
00563     j == y/2 + x/d*h
00564     
00565                                                          O <- [i,j]
00566                                                       -  |
00567                                             r      -     |
00568                                                 -        |
00569                                              -           | h
00570                                           -              |
00571                             [0,0] ->  C -----------------+--------------- T  <- [x,y]
00572                                       | <------ d/2 ---->|
00573               
00574     C - Current position
00575     T - Target position
00576     O - center of circle that pass through both C and T
00577     d - distance from C to T
00578     r - designated radius
00579     h - distance from center of CT to O
00580     
00581     Expanding the equations:
00582  
00583     d -> sqrt(x^2 + y^2)
00584     h -> sqrt(4 * r^2 - x^2 - y^2)/2
00585     i -> (x - (y * sqrt(4 * r^2 - x^2 - y^2)) / sqrt(x^2 + y^2)) / 2 
00586     j -> (y + (x * sqrt(4 * r^2 - x^2 - y^2)) / sqrt(x^2 + y^2)) / 2
00587    
00588     Which can be written:
00589     
00590     i -> (x - (y * sqrt(4 * r^2 - x^2 - y^2))/sqrt(x^2 + y^2))/2
00591     j -> (y + (x * sqrt(4 * r^2 - x^2 - y^2))/sqrt(x^2 + y^2))/2
00592     
00593     Which we for size and speed reasons optimize to:
00594  
00595     h_x2_div_d = sqrt(4 * r^2 - x^2 - y^2)/sqrt(x^2 + y^2)
00596     i = (x - (y * h_x2_div_d))/2
00597     j = (y + (x * h_x2_div_d))/2        */
00598   
00599   // Calculate the change in position along each selected axis
00600   float x = target[gc.plane_axis_0]-gc.position[gc.plane_axis_0];
00601   float y = target[gc.plane_axis_1]-gc.position[gc.plane_axis_1];
00602   
00603   clear_vector(gc.arc_offset);
00604   // First, use h_x2_div_d to compute 4*h^2 to check if it is negative or r is smaller
00605   // than d. If so, the sqrt of a negative number is complex and error out.
00606   float h_x2_div_d = 4 * gc.arc_radius*gc.arc_radius - x*x - y*y;
00607   if (h_x2_div_d < 0) { FAIL(STATUS_ARC_RADIUS_ERROR); return; }
00608   // Finish computing h_x2_div_d.
00609   h_x2_div_d = -sqrt(h_x2_div_d)/hypot(x,y); // == -(h * 2 / d)
00610   // Invert the sign of h_x2_div_d if the circle is counter clockwise (see sketch below)
00611   if (gc.motion_mode == MOTION_MODE_CCW_ARC) { h_x2_div_d = -h_x2_div_d; }
00612   
00613   /* The counter clockwise circle lies to the left of the target direction. When offset is positive,
00614      the left hand circle will be generated - when it is negative the right hand circle is generated.
00615      
00616      
00617                                                    T  <-- Target position
00618                                                    
00619                                                    ^ 
00620         Clockwise circles with this center         |          Clockwise circles with this center will have
00621         will have > 180 deg of angular travel      |          < 180 deg of angular travel, which is a good thing!
00622                                          \         |          /   
00623  center of arc when h_x2_div_d is positive ->  x <----- | -----> x <- center of arc when h_x2_div_d is negative
00624                                                    |
00625                                                    |
00626                                                    
00627                                                    C  <-- Current position                                 */
00628           
00629  
00630   // Negative R is g-code-alese for "I want a circle with more than 180 degrees of travel" (go figure!), 
00631   // even though it is advised against ever generating such circles in a single line of g-code. By 
00632   // inverting the sign of h_x2_div_d the center of the circles is placed on the opposite side of the line of
00633   // travel and thus we get the unadvisably long arcs as prescribed.
00634   if (gc.arc_radius < 0) { 
00635       h_x2_div_d = -h_x2_div_d; 
00636       gc.arc_radius = -gc.arc_radius; // Finished with r. Set to positive for mc_arc
00637   }        
00638   // Complete the operation by calculating the actual center of the arc
00639   gc.arc_offset[gc.plane_axis_0] = 0.5*(x-(y*h_x2_div_d));
00640   gc.arc_offset[gc.plane_axis_1] = 0.5*(y+(x*h_x2_div_d));
00641 }   
00642 
00643 /* 
00644   Not supported:
00645 
00646   - Canned cycles
00647   - Tool radius compensation
00648   - A,B,C-axes
00649   - Evaluation of expressions
00650   - Variables
00651   - Probing
00652   - Override control (TBD)
00653   - Tool changes
00654   - Switches
00655    
00656    (*) Indicates optional parameter, enabled through config.h and re-compile
00657    group 0 = {G92.2, G92.3} (Non modal: Cancel and re-enable G92 offsets)
00658    group 1 = {G38.2, G81 - G89} (Motion modes: straight probe, canned cycles)
00659    group 4 = {M1} (Optional stop, ignored)
00660    group 6 = {M6} (Tool change)
00661    group 8 = {*M7} enable mist coolant
00662    group 9 = {M48, M49} enable/disable feed and speed override switches
00663    group 13 = {G61, G61.1, G64} path control mode
00664 */
Generated by  1.6.3
